skill.name: Recipe Manager
skill.description: Helps add, edit, validate, and manage recipe data in recipes.js. Use this when the user wants to create new recipes, modify existing ones, fix recipe formatting, or validate recipe structure.

skill.author: AdamFehse

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill with no code execution, no file system access, no network calls, and no external commands. It only provides guidance to AI assistants on managing recipe data in recipes.js format.

content.value_statement: Create, edit, and validate recipe entries for CookMode V2. Follow established schema patterns with structured ingredient formatting and proper validation checks.
actual_capabilities: Add new recipes with structured object format
Convert ingredients to structured format with amount, unit, ingredient, prep fields
Fix recipe formatting and syntax issues
limitations: Does not import from external recipe sources directly
Requires manual entry of recipe content

use_cases.title: Digitize Family Recipes
use_cases.description: Convert handwritten or scattered recipes into structured digital format with proper ingredient measurements and preparation notes.

use_cases.title: Maintain Recipe Dataset
use_cases.description: Add new recipes, fix formatting issues, and validate data structure consistency for a cooking application database.

use_cases.title: Standardize Recipe Collection
use_cases.description: Convert recipes from various sources into unified object format for consistent display across platforms.

prompt_templates.title: Add Simple Recipe
prompt_templates.prompt: Add a new recipe for [dish name] to recipes.js. Category: [Entree/Side/Soup/Dessert]. Include ingredients with amount, unit, and ingredient fields.

prompt_templates.title: Convert Ingredients
prompt_templates.prompt: Convert these ingredients to structured object format with amount, unit, ingredient, and prep fields: [paste ingredients list]

prompt_templates.title: Validate Recipe
prompt_templates.prompt: Validate this recipe entry and fix any issues with the schema: [paste recipe]

prompt_templates.title: Bulk Update
prompt_templates.prompt: Update all [category] recipes to use consistent ingredient formatting with proper prep notes for each ingredient.

output_examples.input: Add a chocolate chip cookie recipe to recipes.js with proper structure
output: Components: Dough with 8 ingredients, Mix-ins with chocolate chips
Instructions: 8 steps from preheat to bake

best_practices: Use fraction strings for amounts like '1/2' or '1/4' instead of decimals
Assign consistent categories (Entree, Side, Soup, Dessert) for proper sorting
Include prep field for preparation notes like 'diced', 'softened', or 'divided'
Group ingredients into logical components like 'Dough', 'Filling', 'Sauce'
anti_patterns: Do not use string format for ingredients like '2 cups flour' - use structured objects
Do not skip validation step after adding or editing recipes
Do not mix object and string formats within the same recipe
Do not omit preparation notes that affect cooking results

faq.question: What file formats does this skill support?
faq.answer: This skill manages the recipes.js file format for CookMode V2. It uses structured JavaScript objects with specific fields.

faq.question: How many recipes can I add?
faq.answer: There is no hard limit. The skill can add and validate any number of recipes following the defined schema.

faq.question: Can I integrate with external recipe APIs?
faq.answer: This skill provides schema guidance. External API integration requires custom code outside the skill scope.

faq.question: Is my recipe data safe?
faq.answer: This skill only provides guidance. Actual data modification requires user approval and occurs in their local recipes.js file.

faq.question: Why is my recipe not displaying correctly?
faq.answer: Check validation: ensure category is one of Entree, Side, Soup, Dessert. Verify all ingredients have amount, unit, and ingredient fields.

faq.question: How does this compare to manual entry?
faq.answer: The skill provides schema templates, validation checks, and formatting consistency that reduce errors compared to manual entry.
